channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Richard Simmons, who believed fitness is for everyone, dies at 76
item.description: With his short shorts, sparkly tank tops, frizzy hair and flamboyant personality, Simmons created a fitness empire. He preached positivity, portion control, moving your body — and having fun.
item.content:encoded:
With his short shorts, sparkly tank tops, frizzy hair and flamboyant personality, Simmons created a fitness empire. He preached positivity, portion control, moving your body — and having fun.

(Image credit: American Broadcasting Companies)
item.dc:creator: Kyle Norris

item.title: Trump is fine after apparent gunshots fired at his rally
item.description: Trump was rushed off stage and the rally ended soon thereafter.
item.content:encoded:
Trump was rushed off stage and the rally ended soon thereafter.

(Image credit: Gene J. Puskar)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: As Biden faces concerns over nomination, Republicans prep for their convention
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Barbora Krejcikova beats Jasmine Paolini in Wimbledon women's final
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Washington Post sports reporter Ava Wallace about highlights from the 2024 Wimbledon Championships.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Washington Post sports reporter Ava Wallace about highlights from the 2024 Wimbledon Championships.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: What do older swing state voters think about President Biden's age?
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: How will the Supreme Court's immunity decision affect U.S. democracy?
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with political scientists Daniel Ziblatt and Steven Levitsky about how the recent Supreme Court immunity ruling -- and a second Trump presidency -- could affect the U.S.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with political scientists Daniel Ziblatt and Steven Levitsky about how the recent Supreme Court immunity ruling -- and a second Trump presidency -- could affect the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: 'Colorado In Depth' podcast explores research into psychedelic drugs
item.description: A new podcast from Colorado Public Radio shares the story of a patient undergoing treatment using psychedelics.
item.content:encoded: A new podcast from Colorado Public Radio shares the story of a patient undergoing treatment using psychedelics.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Kenney

item.title: Every ceremony at India's star-studded Ambani wedding, explained
item.description: Kim Kardashian, Bill Gates and other celebs gathered in Mumbai for the "wedding of the year," the marriage of the son of Asia's wealthiest man. But what are all the ceremonies that they witnessed?
item.content:encoded:
Kim Kardashian, Bill Gates and other celebs gathered in Mumbai for the "wedding of the year," the marriage of the son of Asia's wealthiest man. But what are all the ceremonies that they witnessed?

(Image credit: Rafiq Maqbool)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: Israeli military strikes humanitarian zone in Gaza, targeting Hamas leader
item.description: Israeli forces struck a humanitarian zone in the Gaza Strip, targeting the chief of the armed wing of Hamas. Dozens of people were reported killed.
item.content:encoded: Israeli forces struck a humanitarian zone in the Gaza Strip, targeting the chief of the armed wing of Hamas. Dozens of people were reported killed.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Pioneering sex expert Dr. Ruth Westheimer dies at 96
item.description: Westheimer's deep knowledge about human sexual behavior and advocacy of safe sex, along with her pragmatism and sense of humor, catapulted her to national fame in the 1980s.
item.content:encoded:
Westheimer's deep knowledge about human sexual behavior and advocacy of safe sex, along with her pragmatism and sense of humor, catapulted her to national fame in the 1980s.

(Image credit: Willy Sanjuan)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman
